name: Homemade Pastrami Without a Smoker
description: Recipe video above. This is an easy homemade Pastrami for all the poor sods like myself who don't live around the corner from a New York Jewish deli. Tender, juicy and with the signature pastrami spice crust, this is astonishingly straight forward to make - and is outrageously good!ALSO - use the pastrami to make homemade Rebuen sandwiches!
recipeIngredient: 4 lbs / 2kg   good corned beef, with a thick fat cap ((Note 1))
4 tbsp fresh coarsely ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Mix Spice Mix and spread out on a tray. Pat beef dry then roll in Spice Mix, coating well all over. Sprinkle with liquid smoke it using (I rarely use this).
recipeInstructions.name: Mix Spice Mix and spread out on a tray. Pat beef dry then roll in Spice Mix, coating well all over. Sprinkle with liquid smoke it using (I rarely use this).

recipeInstructions.text: Place beef fat cap side down and wrap in a large sheet of foil. Repeat again with another sheet of foil and flip the beef so the fat cap is on the top.
recipeInstructions.name: Place beef fat cap side down and wrap in a large sheet of foil. Repeat again with another sheet of foil and flip the beef so the fat cap is on the top.

recipeInstructions.text: Place rack in slow cooker (Note 2), place beef on rack. Slow cook for 10 hours on low or electric pressure cook for 1 hour 40 minutes (see notes for oven).
recipeInstructions.name: Place rack in slow cooker (Note 2), place beef on rack. Slow cook for 10 hours on low or electric pressure cook for 1 hour 40 minutes (see notes for oven).

recipeInstructions.text: Remove beef, cool then refrigerate for 6 hours +. Reserve juices in slow cooker.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove beef, cool then refrigerate for 6 hours +. Reserve juices in slow cooker.

recipeInstructions.text: Unwrap beef. Place rack on tray, place beef on rack. Bake 30 minutes at 180C/350F until spice crust is set.
recipeInstructions.name: Unwrap beef. Place rack on tray, place beef on rack. Bake 30 minutes at 180C/350F until spice crust is set.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven, slice thinly - pastrami will be tender. Place some pastrami in a dish, spoon over a bit of reserved juices. Cover and microwave to warm (I like to add a slice of Swiss cheese).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven, slice thinly - pastrami will be tender. Place some pastrami in a dish, spoon over a bit of reserved juices. Cover and microwave to warm (I like to add a slice of Swiss cheese).

recipeInstructions.text: New York Deli style Pastrami Sandwich: Pile high on toasted rye bread slathered with plenty of mustard of choice. Serve with pickles on the side! Plus plain potato crisps (for the full deli experience!)

review.reviewBody: Made this the other day and it was wonderful and so quick to put together! My husband loved it and wants me to make again!

After seasoning and wrapping my meat in foil, I realized that I purchased brisket, not corned beef!! Instead of panicking, I decided to sear the meat, then place it (without foil) on a cooking rack in my pressure cooker. I added water with worsestershire sauce at the bottom and pressure cooked for 1.5 hrs.  It turned out delicious!

Absolutely delicious sandwich, couldn't fault it.
